title: Thunderbird 115 Chromebook addons
content: Greetings. I recently installed Thunderbird from the command line in a virtualized Linux environment on a Chromebook. After some difficulties (problematic attempt to import the profile, failed attempt to recover the labels, etc.) I managed to configure and everything seems to work. What absolutely doesn't work is the add-ons section: when I try to install one, at the end of the procedure, Thunderbird freezes and starts again only after restarting the virtual machine. I updated and upgraded the virtualized distro but to no avail. I also tried booting into "troubleshooting mode" but, again, Thunderbird crashes. Has anyone encountered similar problems on other Chromebooks? Thank you.
creator: mauriziodelladio

title: Formatting text in Thunderbird
content: I have moved to Thunderbird (latest update to version 115.4.1). In my old mailprogram, when using HTML, I could compose texts from different sources, then format the text altogether, regardless where they came from and the text appeared as intended at the recipient. In Thunderbird I never really succeeded with that. When I compose text from different sources in a mail, I find no way to assign the same font size to it, not to speak about font type. When I check by sending mails to myself, the texts appear in different sizes, whatever I do. A solution at the moment is to compose the mail in a Word processor, format it there and then copy & paste it to the Thunderbird mail window. But that can hardly be the only way.... Is there any way to format mail when the content consists of texts from different sources?

title: msf arşiv dosyalarını yükleme
content:
Merhabalar,

IMAP te yaşamış olduğumuz depolama sınırlaması sebebiyle hesap konfigürasyonunu POP3 olarak yeniden yapılandırdık. İlk olarak mevcut tüm epostaları arşivledik ve mailler yıl yıl olmak üzere POP3 hesabının arşiv klasörüne kopyalandı. Sonrasında IMAP hesabını sildik.

Fakat thunderbird kapatıp açtıktan sonra POP3 hesabında arşiv klasörlerine dair hiçbir şey kalmadı. "C:\Users\Zeynep ÜNAL\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\ap6ggvim.default-release\Mail\mail.xera.com.tr\Archives.sbd"

klasörünün içerisinde .msf ve uzantısı olmayan dosyalar bulunuyor. (Arşivlerken kaydedilen dosya isimleri) Bu dosyaları tekrar nasıl yükleyebiliriz. Çok acil olduğu için lütfen hızlı bir çözüm önermenizi bekliyoruz. Şimdiden teşekkür ederim.
creator: zunal1

title: Thunderbird window stays hidden when an error dialog is present.
content:
I am using a number of Google calendars in Thunderbird / Lightning. Whenever I am offline, it raises an error dialog saying it cannot connect to the server. If I'm doing something in another window and go to switch the the main TB window (inbox, calendar, cardbook, etc.), nothing happens. I have to go searching via the taskbar for the TB Error dialog, bring it to the front, and then click on the close box. With multiple calendars, I can have multiple error windows to dispatch. This is very annoying. I see 2 problems here: 1) Why is being offline considered an error worthy of a popup (effectively modal) dialog that freezes the rest of TB? This should be an non-intrusive message shown on the main TB window. 2) When this dialog is present, why doesn't it come to to the front when I try to switch to the main TB Window. If it is truly so important for it to get my attention, it shouldn't just hide the main TB window; it should come to the front along with it (an in front of it.)

Does anyone know of any settings to change this behavior?
creator: gmkayaker2

title: Scary message delete behavior when content display blocked
content: In Thunderbird 1153.1 (MacOS), it appears that the "Delete" button next to the header information on a message whose content display is blocked per privacy settings is applied not to that individual message but rather to the folder containing it. There's (fortunately!!) a confirmation dialog warning that that entire folder would be deleted unrecoverably, but it seems non-intuitive and dangerous that the button's scope should change depending on the content display status. When the content is displayable, the button applies only to the individual message, as I'd expect.

title: How to export collected E-Mails from Thunderbird?
content:
After over 10 years of TB its time to move on to a mail client that actually works. I manage 10+ different E-Mail addresses across 3 domains, Since September, the ability of TB to actually work is hit and miss. (Wont get messages, wont send messages, says messages are sent when theyre not, slower than molasses in January, overall TB has really gone down hill IMO) I dont have the time or the patience to go through and try to change a bunch of settings and do all this stuff (across 10+ email accounts, that used to work fine, but no longer work due to the 'upgrade'), just to find out its so screwed up that nothing works and I lose everything again.

So, what I would like to do, is extract client E-Mail address out of TB, so I can put them into a new email client that actually works.

I have tried upgrading down grading before I uninstall it, Id like to get my information out, rebuilding my address book took forever last time.

All E-Mail is stored server side, so not worried about losing anything there.

title: Local Folder Message List Loses Sort Focus/Orientation
content:
Since upgrading to Thunderbird115.4.1 (64-bit) I've seen a persistent problem with some of my Local Folders: the message list pane resets its focus/orientation to the oldest email in the folder when I select that folder even after I manually set it to the newest email the previous time I was in that folder. The attached screen shots illustrate what I'm reporting.

"folder 1" -- When I select a local folder, I see the message list pane showing the most recent emails in the folder, but no email displayed in the message pane.

"folder 2" -- I Tab right 5 times, to move the cursor to the message list pane, and the list re-orients from the bottom to the top, with the oldest message displayed in the message pane. At this point I can press the "End" key on my keyboard and the list re-orients to the most recent message in the folder and that message is displayed. However, the next time I return to the same folder it has reset its orientation to the first message again as shown in the "folder 1" screenshot.

Curiously, this occurs for some but not all of my local folders, and I can find no setting or characteristic that can explain it? I've tried "repairing" the folder but that had no effect.
creator: ph00

title: Sending messages has started failing
content: Sending messages is now failing in Thunderbird. When I first brought up Thunderbird yesterday, I could send without a problem. Sometime during the session, sending began failing. The send would either just spin (so I'd click cancel), or there would be a password failure, and I could enter the correct password and it would continue to be rejected. I've brought Thunderbird down and restarted it multiple times and it continues to fail with send. Receiving messages is not a problem. The SMTP server is not the problem. I wrote a simple Python program using smtplib and it worked fine sending messages with the proper password. I am running Windows 10, Thunderbird Supernova 115.4.1 (64-bit). server name: smtp-server.nc.rr.com port: 587 authentication method: password transmitted insecurely connection security: none Please advise as to next steps.
creator: ricklangston1955

title: Filtered Messages Not Syncing with IMAP Server
content:
I am using Thunderbird 115.4.1 64-bit on Windows 10. I have several mail accounts that all use IMAP. For my mail account that syncs to Roadrunner (TWC) mail, local filtering of messages to local folders is no longer syncing with the server. I have an extensive set of filters that takes mail from my Inbox and moves it to various local folders. The problem is that the messages are not deleted from my Inbox on the IMAP server which sends Thunderbird into a loop of continually downloading and filtering the same message over and over again. If I manually delete a message locally, or move into a folder that is mapped to the server, that seems to work properly. It is only when I move a message to a local folder (manually or with the filters) that the problem occurs.

I appreciate your insight, and I am happy to supply more information as needed.

Cheers, Frank
creator: flthiel5

title: Repeated crashes  [@ OOM | small ] on trying to open Thunderbird.
content:
I'd really appreciate any help you can give me.

I've been using Thunderbird for many years.

TB has been working fine for all those years. and I have probably thousands of emails stored. Then, I went on a trip Sep 28 to Oct 14 and did not use Thunderbird for about 17 days. On my return, I tried to open TB. I found that a screen opened that I hadn't seen before, and TB seemed to be loading. While loading, at the bottom of the screen it said "Checking inbox for new messages...". Then, after a while it crashed without ever opening.

I tried to open TB several times after that, and I've always gotten the same behavior -- ending with a crash and never being able to open TB.

During the loading once, I clicked on Help >AboutThunderbird, which showed 115.3.3.(32-bit) and "Downloading Update 2.4 of 5.4 MB."

The last four Crash Reports, all dated 10/31/2023 are (the last one being the latest): bp-e634fd35-1b8a-488a-a9df-c23050231101 bp-73858652-569e-4362-95d6-030490231101 bp-992529bf-d1af-41d9-a438-43c370231101 bp-c39563fd-bca7-406f-8abf-85bde0231101

I thank you very much for your assistance. D. Prerau --prerau@rcn.com
